ru.ispras.sedna.driver
Interface SednaConnection

public interface SednaConnection

Provides interface for managing transactions and connections. It is not guaranteed to be thread safe.

See Also:
DatabaseManager

Method Summary

          Begins a new transaction.

Method Detail

begin

void begin()
           throws DriverException
Begins a new transaction. For example: 
     SednaConnection con = DatabaseManager.getConnection("localhost", "x", "SYSTEM", "MANAGER");
     con.begin();

Throws:
DriverException - if the transaction has not begun successfully. Exception contains details about the problem occurred.

close

void close()
           throws DriverException
Closes Sedna connection.

Throws:
DriverException - if Sedna server has not managed to close connection properly. Exception contains details about the problem occurred.

commit

void commit()
            throws DriverException
Commits transaction if transaction is running. Otherwise throws exception. For example: 
     SednaConnection con = DatabaseManager.getConnection("localhost", "x", "SYSTEM", "MANAGER");
     con.begin();
     con.commit();

Throws:
DriverException - if the transaction has not been committed successfully. Exception contains details about the problem occurred.

rollback

void rollback()
              throws DriverException
Rollback transaction if transaction is running. Otherwise throws exception. For example: 
     SednaConnection con = DatabaseManager.getConnection("localhost", "x", "SYSTEM", "MANAGER");
     con.begin();
     con.rollback();

Throws:
DriverException - if the transaction has not been rollback successfully. Exception contains details about the problem occurred.

createStatement

SednaStatement createStatement()
                               throws DriverException
Creates SednaStatement object that allows to execute queries, updates and to load XML documents into the Sedna database.

Returns:
new SednaStatement instance
Throws:
DriverException - if driver failed to create statement. Exception contains details about the problem occurred.

setTraceOutput

void setTraceOutput(boolean doTrace)
                    throws DriverException
Sedna supports fn:trace function for debugging purpose (see Sedna Programmer's Guide for details). By default trace output is included into XQuery query result. You can turn trace output on/off using this method

Parameters:
doTrace - set to true if you want to get trace output (default case). Set to false otherwise.
Throws:
DriverException - if failed to set trace output. Exception contains details about the problem occurred.

setDebugMode

void setDebugMode(boolean debug)
                  throws DriverException
Setting connection into debug mode allows getting debug information when XQuery query fails due to some reason (see Sedna Programmer's Guide for details for details). When the query fails debug information is accessible through DriverException.getDebugInfo(). To set the connection into debug mode use this method. For example: 
 try {
     SednaConnection con = DatabaseManager.getConnection("localhost", "x", "SYSTEM", "MANAGER");
     con.setDebugMode(true);
     con.begin();
     SednaStatement st1 = con.createStatement();
     boolean call_res = st1.execute("doc('region')/regions/*");
     con.commit();
     con.close();
  } catch (DriverException e) {
          System.out.println(e.toString());
          System.out.println(e.getDebugInfo());
  }

Parameters:
debug - set to true if you want to set connection into debug mode, otherwise set to false (default case).
Throws:
DriverException - If some problems occurred while trying to set session mode

setReadonlyMode

void setReadonlyMode(boolean mode)
                     throws DriverException
Changes the mode of the next transactions. Transaction can be set to run as read-only or update-transactions. Read-only transactions have one major benefit: they never wait for other transactions (they do not have to acquire any document/collection locks). However they might access slightly obsolete state of the database (for example, they probably would not see the most recent committed updates). You should use read-only transactions in a highly concurrent environment. Notice that the current transaction, if any, will be forcefully committed.

Parameters:
mode - set to true if you want to run next transactions in read-only mode, otherwise set to false (default case).
Throws:
DriverException - If some problems occurred while trying to set session mode

isClose

boolean isClose()
Retrieves whether this connection is already closed or not. A connection is closed if the method close() was called on it or if fatal errors have occurred.

Returns:
true is connection has been closed or there has been some fatal error on the connection; false is connection is ok.
